titleStmt.title: His Maiesties last speech to the lords of his Privie councell and others at his first notice of the intentions of the city of London, concerning their petition for peace wherein is briefly exprest the royall disposition of His excellent Majesty toward that honourable city, and his good inclination toward the kingdome in generall.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

titleStmt.title: His Maiesties last speech to the lords of his Privie councell and others at his first notice of the intentions of the city of London, concerning their petition for peace wherein is briefly exprest the royall disposition of His excellent Majesty toward that honourable city, and his good inclination toward the kingdome in generall.

Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: Occasioned by the humble petition of the major, aldermen and commons of the citie of London ...
"The original Oxford edition probably does not exist." -- cf. Madan.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
